Comments
small campus so almost everyone know everyone and looks out for each other. they do not have any officers that i am aware for general campus. the doors however are patrolled.
this is minimal but is available. i have not looked any deeper in to it.
variety is very good. they are open to the entire student body.
students with children who need on site childcare. students wanting to study native americans. student who are dedicated to graduation.
none that i am aware of.
very reasonable tuition and books. financial aid department always looking for new scholarship opportunities.
ski and snowboard club major fun. nature walks year round. summer swimming at the local beaches.
good quality but poor quantity and options. needs variety and value pricing added. recomended for those with good funding
i have never been involved in the dorms. i know that it is a new facility and well managed. so i would say check em out!

there is a variety of academics at all college levels. the instructors are very serious and passionate about the academic standard. i would rate a five if the academics where more versatile for students in their junior year.
apply for scholarships very early. ask question and explain in detail any concerns. get to know the staff.

is a very open and understanding facility. they keep the students needs in mind during all decision making processes. they are flexible and willing to assist students in making sure they can stay in school.

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Lena from LA Conner, WA 01/27/2012 Reviewer is A current student here. 1 out of 1 people found this review useful. 2 of 14 Categories Comments What to do for fun lots of student centered activities on the main campus in bellingam. Food and Dining no dining available at swinomish site. In three sentences northwest is an amazing college institute. it is small enough to be personal and involved in our native culture; yet with enough degrees to accommodate every one's needs. could use more resources at the smaller campuses.
